text: Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

Ro: Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies! Today
I have a special guest Ingrid!
Ingrid: Hi guys!

Ro: Ha, ha, ha, ha she has a channel that
I really love! It’s called

Ro: Miss Glamorazzi, I’ll put a link down
below. And she also does other
Ro: recipes there.

Ingrid: Yes, I do. But I’ve never made donuts
before so I’m super excited!

Ro: Yes! Today we are gonna be making donuts
from Simpsons because I got

Ro: so many requests for them, and, Ingrid
was the perfect guest because she

Ro: likes donuts! Ingrid: donuts are my favorite
food, literally!

Ro: Couldn’t have been a perfect more…
More perfect person to have on today.
Ro: So let’s get started!
Ingrid: Let’s do this!
Ro: Yeah!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: 1 cup
of regular flour, 1/3 cup of

Ro: regular sugar, a bunch of rainbow sprinkles,
a teaspoon of baking powder,

Ro: 1 and 1/2 teaspoons of vanilla extract,
1/4 a teaspoon of nutmeg,

Ro: 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 cup of
milk, 1/4 cup of greek yogurt,

Ro: 1 egg, and 2 tablespoons of butter. You
will also need…

Ingrid: Some baking spray, a couple of plastic
bags, some mixing bowls, a whisk

Ingrid: This super cute little mixer that
I’m really jealous of because I

Ingrid: love the color, I’m gonna have to
get this.
Ro: I recommend this, it was so good.

Ingrid: And then, a donut tin! This is basically
like a cupcake tin,
Ingrid: but for donuts, so it’s way cooler!

Ro: Oh yeah, now let’s put it all together!
Ingrid: Let’s do this! Ro: Oh yeah!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is you’re gonna take a big mixing bowl

Ro: and we’re gonna mix together all of
our dry ingredients.
Ro: Will you be the whisker?

Ingrid: I’m gonna be the whisk taker ha,
ha, ha!
Ro: Ah-wah-wah-wah-wah-wah!

Ro: 1st you’re gonna add your flour, wee-oop!
Then your sugar, here you go!
Ro: You can start whiskin’.
Ro: Baking soda, baking powder, and nutmeg!
Ingrid: Oh yeah, nutmeg smells so good.
Ro: Yeah it does. Ingrid: Oh!

Ro: If you like nutmeg, this is a really good
recipe!

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your 2nd bowl
and we’’re gonna mix together our wet

Ro: ingredients. Alright, I’m gonna have
you pour in the milk.

Ingrid: Alright! Ro: OK, and I’ll scoop
in the greek yogurt.

Ro: Are you clumsy too? I’m clumsy! Ingrid:
Very! Very messy.
Ro: Oh my god we’re gonna get along great!

Ro: Now we’re gonna add in our butter, I’ve
just melted it. Here we go,

Ro: oooh! You keep mixing, you’re doing
great. Ingrid: I’m mixing.
Ro: Oh yeah, and, 1 egg.

Ingrid: Now we’re gonna take the wet ingredients
and pour

Ingrid: them into the dry ingredients. So,
here we go!
Ro: Nice, nice, nice, nice, nice! Oh yeah!

Ingrid: OK, so, I’m always afraid of making
flour fly everywhere, but I’m gonna

Ingrid: try my best! Ro: It’s OK, we do
that all the time!

Ro: Do you see how quiet it is? Ingrid:
Yeah! Ro: It’s quiet and powerful…

Ingrid: And cute! Ro: Best mixer I’ve ever
had, and I’m gonna be the scraper,

Ro: I’m gonna scrape down the sides, and
you’re gonna keep doing this until
Ro: the mixture is really thick.

Ro: Now we’ve got our batter all mixed together
and now, it is almost time to bake.

Ro: But first, we’re going to prep our pan.
Ingrid: That’s right! Ro: Yeah!

Ingrid: TIme to spray it down with
some baking spray.

Ro: It’s pretty easy. Ingrid: So… Ro:
And if you don’t have baking spray you
Ro: can use butter, anything you’ve got.

Ro: We’re gonna pour the batter into this
Ziploc bag so it’s easier to distribute

Ro: in our little donut trays. Here we go,
OK. Oh jeez! This bowl!

Ingrid: 2 clumsy people together, what will
happen? Ro: Oh no!

Ro: OK, is it coming out? Ingrid: Yeah. Ro:
I can’t really see very good.

Ingrid: Almost there, almost there, you got
it! You got it! Ro: OK!

Ro: Got the batter in the bag, just gonna
snip the little tip, bewp!

Ro: Then what you’re gonna do is you just
want to fill these about 1/2 way,

Ro: they rise a lot. This is a good recipe
but just know that they will rise.

Ro: So just go roooop all the way around,
just like that.

Ingrid: Yeah, just a little guy! They start
off as a little guy.

Ingrid: Now that our batter is in the tray,
we’re going to pop this into our

Ingrid: oven which has been heated to 350
degrees, and it’s going to bake for

Ingrid: 9-10 minutes until its nice and golden brown
around the edges.

Ro: Yes! And while they’re baking we’re
going to show you how
Ro: to make a donut glaze.

Ro: To make this donut glaze, it’s pretty
easy, all you’re gonna need is

Ro: 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 2 cups
of powdered sugar, and 1/4 a cup

Ro: of milk. Ingrid: You’ll also need a
medium sized saucepan and a little
Ingrid: spoon to mix it all together.

Ro: Yeah, so we’re just gonna combine everything
into the pan right now and

Ro: we’ll take it over to the stove and
heat it up.

Ro: Put the saucepan on a medium heat and
continue to mix the

Ro: ingredients until everything is dissolved
and combined.

Ro: The donuts are fresh out of the oven and
we’ve got our glaze ready,

Ro: it’s still warm, right off the stove.
So what you’re gonna do is take a drying

Ro: rack and then underneath I have a little
cookie sheet, to catch the

Ro: extra glaze. And you’re just gonna take
one of these little warm donuts

Ro: and you’re just gonna plop him in here.
And I’m gonna let you do this,
Ro: just flip him over with the spoon.
Ingrid: This smells really good!

Ro: And then just scoop him up and plop him
right back on here.

Ro: Do this to the rest of your donuts and
then we’re going to decorate!
Ingrid: Yes!

Ingrid: Alright, so we’ve let these guys
sit for about 15-20 minutes, just so

Ingrid: they can harden, now what are we gonna
be doing next?

Ro: Alright, next we are gonna be decorating
with cookie icing!

Ro: So here in these little plastic bags…
Ingrid: Oooooh!

Ro: We have pink cookie icing with a number
2 tip at the top.

Ro: You don’t need to do these fancy little
tips at the top,

Ro: I just like it because it’s easier to
control.

Ro: And now what you’re gonna do is just
paint little cookie icing at the top.
Ro: Weee-ooooo

Ingrid: Do a little squiggly. Ro: Yeah make
it squiggly so it will look like

Ro: The Simpsons donut. Then we’re gonna
put some rainbow sprinkles on the top.
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are The Simpson donuts that we just
made! Thank you so much Ingrid
Ro: for your help today!

Ingrid: Thank you for having me! This was
so much fun and they look amazing!

Ro: They look just like from the game, if
you guys have ever played any Simpson

Ro: games, I used to play the old arcade
game where, like, Lisa had her little

Ro: jumprope, Bart had his skateboard, and
I know Ingrid played some
Ro: Simpsons games too.

Ingrid: Yes, I played the road rage game that
was for Playstation and I

Ingrid: was so addicted to it! Just like,
driving around Springfield and stuff it
Ingrid: was one of my all time favorites!

Ro: Yeah! Simpsons has a special place in
our hearts! Such a cute little thing!

Ro: Alright, I will put all of Ingrid’s
links down below, go check her out,

Ro: she is awesome. And also, if you have
any other ideas for any other

Ro: Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave
me a comment down below and I
Ro: will do my best to make it happen!

Ro: Also, I will be posting lots of pictures
of these little donuts on
Ro: Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and Instagram!

Ro: If you guys make these donuts please send
me a picture, I love seeing your

Ro: baking creations, I get a big kick out
of it, it makes my day!
Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!

Ingrid: I’m just gonna take these guys,
and, uh…
Ro: Huhhhhhhh!
Ingrid: Don’t mind me!
Ro: Meep-meep-meep-meep-meep-meep, ahahahaha!
